meanings.definition: Relating to the use of the senses in evaluating food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared an organoleptically pleasing dish that delighted our taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The wine was organoleptically rich, with a deep aroma and a satisfying taste.
meanings.sent3: The organoleptically gifted food critic could taste the color of the rainbow in every bite.
meanings.sent4: The spices danced organoleptically on my tongue, creating a symphony of flavors.
meanings.sent5: Her ability to discern subtle flavors organoleptically set her apart as a true connoisseur.

meanings.definition: Perceived by the senses, especially taste or smell.
meanings.sent1: The freshly baked bread was organoleptically irresistible, drawing everyone to the bakery.
meanings.sent2: The flowers emitted an organoleptically pleasant fragrance that filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The chef's organoleptically enhanced sense of smell led him to discover the secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of coffee organoleptically awakened my senses, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The perfume was organoleptically captivating, leaving a trail of allure wherever she went.
